DataElement.preferredName: Patient Malignant Neoplasm Related Pain Personal Medical History Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator of whether or not the participant is experiencing tumor-related pain.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Malignant Neoplasm Related Pain Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a patient's personal medical history, an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced, and pain related to a malignant neoplasm.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Related Pain Personal Medical History
Property.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:Related; connected or associated.:An unpleasant sensation induced by noxious stimuli and generally received by specialized nerve endings.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.
The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.
